isis.stitle: Body Builder Electrical Data Book for Models Built Starting March 1, 2007 - PTO (Power Take Off) - 16WLM - PTO Hourmeter

svcproc.title: 16WLM - PTO Hourmeter
svcproc.para: 16WLM - HOURMETER, PTO for Customer Provided PTO; Indicator Light and Hourmeter in Gauge Cluster Includes Return Wire for PTO Feedback Switch

FEATURE/BODY FUNCTION: This feature provides the customer with a wire (Circuit K88B 14 gauge, light green - cut blunt - located in the transmission harness) to be wired into a PTO body builder-installed feedback switch. Also included in this feature is a PTO indicator light in the gauge cluster and a PTO hourmeter, which allows the operator to measure stationary PTO hours for maintenance records and fuel tax purposes. To view the hourmeter, press the gauge cluster selection button momentarily until the text portion of the display indicates "PTO Hour".

note.para: This feature cannot be used if 16HGJ (Optional Transmission Oil Temperature Gauge for a MANUAL Transmission) is utilized.

svcproc.para: Software feature codes that must be added: 595AJU and 595AYN
Software feature codes that must NOT be enabled: 595AEW
The BC_PTO_Engaged_Param parameter defines the voltage that will be read as the active state for the PTO engagement feedback switch.

entry.para: Active State for the PTO engagement feedback switch.

svcproc.para: • The customer must wire the International-provided PTO engagement feedback return wire (14 gauge, Light Green) into the PTO feedback switch which should be a GND active switch.

step1.para: Customer should apply the correct active state voltage (as programmed in the Diamond Logic® Builder software) to the International-provided PTO engagement feedback wire.
Verify that the PTO indicator light in the gauge cluster comes on and stays on as long as the active state voltage is applied.

item.para: The customer must enable software feature code 595AJU and 595AYN using the Diamond Logic® Builder software.
The customer must make sure that software feature code 595AEW is NOT enabled using the Diamond Logic® Builder software.
The customer must set BC_PTO_Engaged_Param to desired active state for the PTO feedback switch.

When adding this feature to a vehicle, alternate wiring methods must be performed. It is not possible to add a wire to connector 1702 pin 13 as described by the electrical circuit diagram manual. The dash panel grommet is sealed, and additional wires may not be added.
In order to add this feature, connect an 18 gauge wire to the PTO feedback switch, and terminate it in an open wire terminal cavity in connector 1700 or 1701.
Add another 18 gauge wire in the corresponding cavity on the cab harness connector, and terminate it in the BC Connector 1600 terminal pin B7.
